name: Clin N Penis
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Regional lymph nodes**

    Inguinal
        Deep inguinal, NOS
           Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal)
        Superficial inguinal (femoral) 
        Inguinal node, NOS (unknown if superficial or deep)

    Pelvic lymph  nodes, NOS
        External iliac
        Internal iliac (hypogastric)
            Obturator
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done: 
    Physician unable to assess N
    Regional lymph node involvement cannot be determined or findings inconclusive
Physician assigns cNX, no other information available to determine N
No palpable or visibly enlarged inguinal lymph nodes
Palpable mobile unilateral inguinal lymph node

Regional lymph nodes, not stated if single, multiple or bilateral:
 
SINGLE regional lymph node, NOS
Not stated if single or multiple lymph nodes 

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1

Palpable mobile multiple OR  

Bilateral inguinal lymph nodes

MULTIPLE or BILATERAL regional lymph nodes:
    
Stated as N2

Fixed inguinal nodal mass OR 

Pelvic lymphadenopathy unilateral or bilateral

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Clinical classification criteria not met
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    No information about diagnostic workup
    Results not documented in record
Tumor first detected on surgical resection (no clinical workup)
Evidence of metastatic disease [(cM1) or (pM1)], no other workup
Only Clinical Stage Group documented (no T, N, or M information available)
